___target.description: The target file to be executed. You can use variables here in brackets e.g. $(currentDirectory) ilename.ps1

___demands.description: Allows you to define a list of demands that a build agent requires to run this build task.

___instanceNameFormat.description: This is how the task will be displayed within the build step list - you can use variable values by using $(variablename)

___description.description: Detailed description of what your task does

___version.description: Always update this when you release your task, so that the agents utilize the latest code.

___deprecated.description: Task is deprecated only when the latest version is marked as deprecated. Deprecated tasks appear at the end of searches under a section that is collapsed by default.

___showEnvironmentVariables.description: Toggles showing the environment variable editor in the task editor UI. Allows passing environment variables to script based tasks.

___groups.description: Describes groups that task properties may be logically grouped by in the UI.

___visibleRule.description: Allow's you to define a rule which dictates when the group will be visible to a user, for example "variableName = value"

___postjobexecution.description: Execution options for this task (on Post-Job stage)

___target.description: The target file to be executed. You can use variables here in brackets e.g. $(currentDirectory) ilename.ps1
The target file to be executed. You can use variables here in brackets e.g. $(currentDirectory) ilename.ps1
The target file to be executed. You can use variables here in brackets e.g. $(currentDirectory) ilename.ps1
The target file to be executed. You can use variables here in brackets e.g. $(currentDirectory) ilename.ps1

___friendlyName.description: Descriptive name (spaces allowed). Must be <= 40 chars

___category.description: Where the task appears in Azure DevOps. Use the 'Azure *' categories for Azure DevOps and Azure DevOps Server 2019. Use the other categories for Team Foundation Server 2018 and below.

___helpMarkDown.description: Help to be displayed when hovering over the help icon for the input. To display URLs use the format [Text To Display](http://Url)

___name.description: The variable name to use to store the user-supplied value

___type.description: The type that dictates the control rendered to the user.

___required.description: Whether the input is a required field (default is false).

___visibleRule.description: Allow's you to define a rule which dictates when the input will be visible to a user, for example "variableName = value"

___label.description: The text displayed to the user for the input label

___defaultValue.description: The default value to apply to this input.

___groupName.description: Setting this to the name of a group defined in 'groups' will place the input into that group.

___target.description: The target file to be executed. You can use variables here in brackets e.g. $(currentDirectory) ilename.ps1

___id.description: A unique guid for this task
